channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump scraps tariff threat and claims ‘framework of a future deal’ on Greenland – live
item.description: US president touts ‘very productive meeting’ with Nato chief Mark Rutte, drops tariffs on European allies and adds deal will involve ‘Golden Dome’ and...

item.title: American democracy on the brink a year after Trump’s inauguration, experts say
item.description: Scale and speed of president’s moves have stunned observers of authoritarian regimes – is the US in democratic peril? Three hundred and sixty-five day...

item.title: ICE targets Somali communities in Maine in new Trump administration crackdown
item.description: Immigration enforcement has sent a surge of federal agents to the fishing state, with about 50 arrests so far The Trump administration has begun anoth...

item.title: Prosecutors barred from reviewing material seized from Washington Post reporter
item.description: Judge issues temporary order after paper had sought return of Hannah Natanson’s devices after ‘outrageous seizure’ A US judge temporarily blocked fede...

item.title: Australia news live: McKenzie hopes Coalition not broken but says it’s ‘up to’ Ley; Joyce says he is ‘not ‘hawking for members’ for One Nation
item.description: Nationals senator says ‘I would call for calmer heads to prevail’. Follow updates live Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Na...

item.title: EU suspends approval of US trade deal over Greenland threats
item.description: The move follows renewed tensions between the US and EU, as Donald Trump pushes to acquire Greenland.

item.title: 'Canada lives because of US', Trump digs at Carney in Davos speech
item.description: The US president also takes aim at France's President Macron and a "repetitive" Swiss leader.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before US Congress in Epstein probe
item.description: The convicted sex trafficker has previously said she would decline to answer questions unless she is granted immunity.

item.title: Seven more countries agree to join Trump's Board of Peace
item.description: Seven Muslim-majority countries publicly accept an invitation to Trump's new organisation, joining Albania, Bahran, Hungary, Morocco and Israel.

item.title: Lords back UK social media ban for under-16s
item.description: It comes as the government looks into its own potential ban, with a consultation closing in the summer.
